pullRequest.body:
Added lemma to prove a graph on an odd number of nodes has an odd
number of odd components, including supporting lemmas. 
In preparation for Tuttes theorem

---

maintainer merge

This almost looks good to me now.

There is one unused argument flagged by the linter, and one unnecessary(?) import, but feel free to merge it after you fix those.

bors d+

```suggestion
import Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Ring.Nat
import Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Subgraph
import Mathlib.Data.Fintype.Card
import Mathlib.Order.ConditionallyCompleteLattice.Basic
```
so that it stays somewhat alphabetical

`â‹ƒ` is called `iUnion`. Also your LHS is simpler than your RHS
```suggestion
lemma iUnion_supp : â‹ƒ c : G.ConnectedComponent, c.supp = (Set.univ : Set V) := by
```
or even
```suggestion
lemma iUnion_supp : â‹ƒ c : G.ConnectedComponent, c.supp = Set.univ := by
```
if it works

```suggestion
  refine eq_univ_of_forall fun v â†¦ âŸ¨G.connectedComponentMk v, ?_âŸ©
```

```suggestion
lemma pairwise_disjoint_supp : Pairwise fun c c' â†¦ Disjoint c.supp c'.supp := by
```
Can you show the stronger statement that the number of odd components is odd?
Done:) I did need a little bit more of a specific helper lemma, and I don't think there was a natural place to put it, so I created a new file for that one.
Merge accident? Those lemmas are already there with a different name

Fixed:)

I'm probably going to avoid stacked PRs for a bit, but if I want to do them I should probably do an interactive rebase to import changes from main? Is it okay to force push to branches then?

> if I want to do them I should probably do an interactive rebase to import changes from main?

Yes that's exactly how I do it

> Is it okay to force push to branches then?

It's definitely fine to force push so long as you're confident only you (and possibly git experts) are working on that branch. If you're collaborating on a branch with git beginners, you might turn them into angry beginners.
Could that be `...BigOperators.Ring.Nat`?

```suggestion

```

```suggestion
    (h : Even (s.filter fun x â†¦ Odd (f x)).card) : Even (âˆ‘ i âˆˆ s, f i) := by
```
no?

```suggestion
    Pairwise fun c c' : ConnectedComponent G â†¦ Disjoint c.supp c'.supp := by
```
Accident?

This was due to a `lake exe shake --fix` after this [failed build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10009285873/job/27667845563). Looks like it isn't necessary indeed, so I removed it.
Oh yeah I see
Accident?
Same as the other one

```suggestion
  have (a : Î¹) : (if Â¬Even (f a) then f a % 2 else 0) = if Â¬Even (f a) then 1 else 0 := by
```
or
```suggestion
  have (a) : (if Â¬Even (f a) then f a % 2 else 0) = if Â¬Even (f a) then 1 else 0 := by
```
by letting Lean do more work for you
Maybe make `G` explicit in `ConnectedComponent.iUnion_supp`?

```suggestion
    â† (set_fintype_card_eq_univ_iff _).mpr G.ConnectedComponent.iUnion_supp,
```
works hopefully. If it doesn't try renaming the lemma to something out of the `ConnectedComponent` namespace
Needed the latter, done:)

```suggestion
lemma iUnion_connectedComponentSupp (G : SimpleGraph V) :
    â‹ƒ c : G.ConnectedComponent, c.supp = Set.univ := by
```
or something like that, to make clear it's about connected components?

Sorry, I should have mentioned that earlier, but can this also take `G` explicit and be put outside the `ConnectedComponent` namespace?
```suggestion
lemma pairwise_disjoint_connectedComponentSupp :
    Pairwise fun c c' : ConnectedComponent G â†¦ Disjoint c.supp c'.supp := by
```
Done:)
It would be nice to turn this into an `iff`
and to have an `iff` with 2 evens replaced by odd.

Can probably be golfed further, but here is a slicker proof:
```lean
lemma even_sum_iff_even_card_odd {s : Finset Î¹} (f : Î¹ â†’ â„•) :
    Even (âˆ‘ i âˆˆ s, f i) â†” Even (s.filter fun x â†¦ Odd (f x)).card := by
  rw [â† Finset.sum_filter_add_sum_filter_not _ (fun x â†¦ Even (f x)), Nat.even_add]
  simp only [Finset.mem_filter, and_imp, imp_self, implies_true, Finset.even_sum, true_iff]
  rw [Nat.even_iff, Finset.sum_nat_mod, Finset.sum_filter]
  simp (config := { contextual := true }) only [â† Nat.odd_iff_not_even, Nat.odd_iff.mp]
  simp_rw [â† Finset.sum_filter, â† Nat.even_iff, Finset.card_eq_sum_ones]
```
Thanks, used this and added the Odd variant

That is quite some new imports in an already long file. Maybe put the new lemmas (and any already existing related lemmas) in a new file?

I also don't see how the new imports are actually used in the new lemmas?

This was actually a leftover, the imports are only needed for `WalkCounting.lean`, fixed. (I don't know why the treeshaking didn't pick up on this?)

Fixed.
This is a lot of new transitive imports, but this is a small specialized (leaf?) file, so it's probably fine.
The results here build on the Decidability instances here. I would be okay splitting it off in a separate file if that's preferred.
separate out as a lemma `toFinset_iUnion`

I've tried to, but it seems this statements really needs the `instDecidableMemSupp` above to work out.

This is what I've got, but I don't know how to add a "variable instance" like `[Decidable v âˆˆ f x]` for all v, x.
```
lemma toFinset_iUnion {W} [Fintype W] [Fintype V] (f : W â†’ Set V) : Set.toFinset (â‹ƒ (x : W), f x) =
    Finset.biUnion (Finset.univ : Finset W) (fun x => (f x).toFinset) := by
  sorry
```

Or were you suggesting to have a lemma that is still specialized to ConnectedComponent?

This type-checks:
```lean
import Mathlib.Data.Set.Finite

lemma toFinset_iUnion {V W : Type*} [Fintype W] [Fintype V] [DecidableEq V] (f : W â†’ Set V)
    [âˆ€ w, Fintype (f w)] :
    Set.toFinset (â‹ƒ (x : W), f x) =
    Finset.biUnion (Finset.univ : Finset W) (fun x => (f x).toFinset) := by
  sorry
```
Thanks, managed to fill this in. I placed it close to the dependency on the needed Fintype instance, I couldn't really see a better place to put it.
Looks good
The statement uses both `Fintype.card` and `Nat.card`. Would it be possible to only use one, and consistently use that one in the proof as well?
Used `Nat.card` consistently
Ideally these two lemmas should be proven about arbitrary equivalence relations. That might be outside the scope of this PR, but maybe leave a comment?
Added TODOs

```suggestion
  simp_rw [Set.disjoint_left]
  intro _ _ h a hsx hsy
  rw [ConnectedComponent.mem_supp_iff] at hsx hsy
  rw [hsx] at hsy
  exact h hsy
```
Adopted:)
Can you also turn this into an `iff`, and golf its proof? (e.g. the lemma `odd_sum_iff_odd_card_odd` should make this proof shorter, right?)
Done:) I suspect someone with more experience could golf it a bit more, but this is as far as I'm able to take it currently.

```suggestion
```
Oops. Fixed.
You're not using this in this file, right?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat({Algebra/BigOperators,Combinatorics/SimpleGraph}): Odd cardinality of odd components
